intro: Securinega samoana, commonly known as the Samoan milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic, which serves as a defense mechanism against herbivores. It thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ecological role includes providing nectar for pollinators and supporting local biodiversity.
